quest.name: The Gridanian Envoy
journal: Kan–E–Senna would entrust you with a task of great import.

Appointing you her personal envoy, Kan–E–Senna bids you deliver a missive to the other two leaders of the Eorzean Alliance. In order to facilitate your journey, she bestows upon you an airship pass, which will allow you to travel by air between the three allied nations. Before making your way to the airship landing, be sure to quiz Miounne as to what awaits beyond the boundaries of the Twelveswood.

In addition to Gridania, the Eorzean Alliance encompasses the city–states of Limsa Lominsa and Ul'dah. The airship landing is situated on the lower floor of the Carline Canopy. Make your final preparations for the journey, then speak with Lionnellais at the entrance lobby.
You are now ready to embark upon the first leg of your journey, which will take you to Limsa Lominsa. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Limsa Lominsa, you must now seek an audience with the Admiral. Ask the storm honor guard for assistance.
The Admiral awaits you in her command room on the Bridge. Take the Crow's Lift to Bulwark Hall, and present Kan–E–Senna's missive to Zanthael before the Admiral's Lift to gain admission.

Admiral Bloefhiswyn is receptive to the proposal detailed in Kan–E–Senna's missive. It appears the Garlean Empire still poses a grave threat to Eorzea, with the XIVth Imperial Legion, led by Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, deeply entrenched in the border regions. Your business in Limsa Lominsa successfully concluded, make your way to the airship landing and speak with L'nophlo.
You are now ready to embark upon the second leg of your journey, which will take you to Ul'dah. Make your way to the landing area and await departure.
Having safely arrived in Ul'dah, you must now seek an audience with the Flame General. Ask the flame honor guard for assistance.
The Flame General awaits you at the Royal Promenade. Present Kan–E–Senna's missive to Bartholomew on the Hustings Strip to gain admission.

Having now passed on Kan–E–Senna's message to the leaders of both Limsa Lominsa and Ul'dah, you have discharged your duty as the Elder Seedseer's envoy, and learned of the various threats facing Eorzea in the process. Given the immensity of the forces at work, you are moved to wonder what meaningful contribution a lone adventurer might make to the realm's preservation. Perhaps the answer will be revealed to you in the days to come.
objectives: Speak with Lionnellais at the airship landing.
Speak with the storm honor guard.
Present Kan–E–Senna's missive to Zanthael at Bulwark Hall.
Speak with L'nophlo at the airship landing.
Speak with the flame honor guard.
Present Kan–E–Senna's missive to Bartholomew on the Hustings Strip.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Thank you for hearing me out.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I have written a letter to my counterparts in the Eorzean Alliance.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The Battle of Carteneau and the Calamity that followed claimed countless souls, and left countless more bereft and alone. In the dark days that followed, many were the survivors who thought themselves less fortunate than the dead.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Five years have come and gone, but the land and the people still bear the wounds of the devastation.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Nor are we any closer to learning the fate of the Warriors of Light.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet so long as we live, never must we give up hope. We owe this to those who laid down their lives that we might behold another dawn.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: In remembrance of them, a memorial service will soon be held upon the anniversary of the Battle of Carteneau. This missive bears the details of that service.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: You graciously accepted the part of Emissary in the recent ceremony.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Should you be so willing, I would now make you my envoy, and have you bear my message to our allies.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Your dedication to the people of Gridania rouses fond memories in me, and I would choose no other for the role. Will you do me this favor?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Humbly, I thank you.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: As you are no doubt aware, our partners in the Eorzean Alliance lie some considerable distance away. Nor are Ul'dah and Limsa Lominsa close to one another.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet fear not, for I have no intention of subjecting you, mine own newly anointed envoy, to a journey which would take weeks by land.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: No, I mean for you to travel by air. Receive of me this airship pass. With it, you may make use of the skyways that connect the three city–states of the Alliance.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The airship landing is situated upon the lower floor of the Carline Canopy. Simply show your pass, and you will be admitted to the departure area. Before you embark upon your journey, however, you would do well to seek the worldly wisdom of Miounne. Few forestborn Gridanians know more of the lands beyond the Twelveswood than she.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: In better times, airships were available for the convenience of one and all. Alas, the risk that our crafts may fall to imperial attack has forced a reduction in the number of flights.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Consequently, it has become necessary to restrict air travel only to those whose need is great. Such individuals may petition the relevant parties to be issued an airship pass. As you may have deduced, I myself am one such party.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: ...Yet I was not alone in desiring that you be granted the privilege of air travel.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Such is the potential you show.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: We have no doubt but that you will reward our faith in you, Forename.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: By the power vested in me, I bid you journey forth as my envoy into the great realm of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Walk her fields, brave her seas, and strive to know her better.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And wheresoever you go, go without fear, for the path shall ever be revealed to those who are true of heart.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Guided by the Crystal's light, set forth, and discover your destiny.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see you up and about again, Forename. Tell me, did you pay the Elder Seedseer a visit as I bade?

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Appointed personal envoy!?

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: And now you are to bear the Elder Seedseer's missive to our allies...

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Well! It seems you've made an impression on the great woman! I can't argue with her judgment, though. You've earned this honor with tireless hard work, and anyone who says you don't deserve it had better not do so in my hearing!

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: I find myself praising you often of late, but Mother is truly proud of you.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Short of a Warrior of Light, I can imagine no better adventurer to represent us─and that, my girllad, is some compliment!

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: But I've flattered you enough for one day. And I don't want your head to get too big, or you'll struggle to lug it around the realm. Speaking of which, Eorzea is a big old place.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Now that you have an airship pass, you can really start to broaden your horizons. The sky's quite literally the limit.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Even if your errand didn't call for it, I would strongly suggest visiting the two other city–states of the Alliance before you go anywhere else. They are, of course, Limsa Lominsa, city of pirates, and Ul'dah, jewel of the desert.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Once you've acquainted yourself with them, you can turn your sights on whichever lesser-trodden region takes your fancy.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: The Calamity changed the face of Eorzea, and much of her now lies in shadow, beyond man's ken. It's a veritable playground for a wide-eyed adventurer like your good self.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Mind you, it won't all be fun and games.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Each nation faces its fair share of problems, from internal strife to conflict with the beast tribes and their primals. So don't be too surprised if you find yourself embroiled in the odd unsavory situation on your travels.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: But no matter what difficulties you encounter, I am confident that you will pull through, and emerge the stronger for the experience.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: These are interesting times for Eorzea, Forename. It's been five years now since the Calamity, but folk are finally beginning to look to the future.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: A period of great change is upon us, and you have a part to play in it. And if that prospect doesn't excite you, I don't know what will!

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Greetings, good madamsir. This is the reservation counter for Limsa Lominsa-bound flights.

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Oh, are you not Forename Surname, the Elder Seedseer's personal envoy? We at Highwind Skyways are honored to serve you! Will you be flying with us today?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Very well. When you are ready to board, please let me know.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: The airship bound for Limsa Lominsa will be departing shortly. Are you ready to board, madamsir?

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Thank you for using Highwind Skyways. The airship to Ul'dah will be departing shortly.

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Very well. When you are ready to board, please let me know.

dialogue.name: ANNOUNCE
dialogue.text: Attention, all passengers: the airship bound for Limsa Lominsa is about to depart. Please make your way to the boarding gate.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: Farewell, Forename.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: One day, minstrels will sing of your deeds.

dialogue.name: MIOUNNE
dialogue.text: May you ever walk in the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)It has been fifteen years, but the bitter taste of defeat lingers still...

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Fifteen years since the imperial fleet set course for Mor Dhona, led by the Agrius, mightiest of all vessels.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Silvertear Lake lay ripe for the taking, and all of Eorzea would soon be ours...or so we believed.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)But an innumerable host of dragons met us that day, at the heart of which flew the great Midgardsormr.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Though we succeeded in slaying that lord among wyrms, the dread serpent's defeat was bought at too high a price.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Our invincible flagship was lost, and all hope of victory with her. So ended our glorious conquest.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Eorzea... A blighted realm, riddled with false gods...

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Twice now it has eluded the Empire's grasp.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)For all the destruction it wrought, even Meteor, the Great Sin, failed to yield us control over it.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)And for this failure, the realm has sunk deeper into depravity.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)It is twisted beyond all reckoning─rotten nigh to the core.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Yet it must be saved.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Only Garlean rule can bring order to Eorzea. It falls to us to deliver the misguided masses from their ignorance.

dialogue.name: HUKUKANS
dialogue.text: (-All-)We are of one mind, Lord van Baelsar.

dialogue.name: ANNOUNCE
dialogue.text: Senior engineers, please report to magitek research following the scheduled inspection.

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: Hey. Is the legatus really planning to take another tilt at Eorzea?

dialogue.name: ENGINEERB
dialogue.text: Eh!? What hole have you been hiding in? We're in the midst of preparing for a new campaign, and a huge one at that!

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: But...I thought the Emperor had given up the western lands for lost after Carteneau. What could the legatus possibly hope to gain by acting alone?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: (-???-)I sense you harbor certain doubts over the wisdom of the legatus's plan.

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: M-My lord!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Please, call me Nero. Tell me, where were you born?

dialogue.name: ENGINEERB
dialogue.text: Othard, milord!

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: Ala Mhigo, my lord!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Ah, Codename Hummingway, I presume?

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: I-I don't know what you─

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Silence. Your denials will not change your fate.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: I assure you─Frumentarium sees all.

dialogue.name: ENGINEERA
dialogue.text: Argh...

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Clean up this mess. And do not miss any, or I shall be most displeased.

dialogue.name: ENGINEERB
dialogue.text: A-At once, milord!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Garlond... Soon you will be made to know the true power of magitek.

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Gridania! Welcome to Limsa Lominsa, my ladymy lord. Admiral Bloefhiswyn awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: You are the Gridanian envoy? Welcome to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: The Admiral has been looking forward to your arrival.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Please proceed to the Crow's Lift at your earliest convenience. It will take you to Bulwark Hall.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Once there, pray speak with Zanthael. He will be pleased to show you in to the Admiral's command room on the Bridge.

dialogue.name: STORMA
dialogue.text: Pray speak with Zanthael in Bulwark Hall. He will be pleased to show you in to the Admiral's command room on the Bridge.

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir, and welcome to our fair city. If you would permit me to examine the seal on the missive you carry...

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Yes, everything seems to be in order. My apologies. We cannot afford to be complacent, you understand. Please, step this way.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I did not expect the Gridanian envoy to be an adventurer. It speaks highly of your character that the Elder Seedseer would choose an outsider to represent her nation's interests.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: This way.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I bid you welcome.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I am Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn, Admiral of Limsa Lominsa, and commander of the Maelstrom.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Now, what news from the Black Shroud?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Before you begin, I would know your name.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Strange. I would readily have sworn that I knew you, but it seems I was mistaken.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I may not recall old friends' faces, but I surely remember my enemies'. Woe betide the Admiral who fails in that!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But I jest. Please, do continue.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Hm. A memorial service to honor the fallen.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Seven hells... Has it been five years?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Five years since the Garlean Empire sought to wrest Eorzea from our grasp...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: It was in answer to the imperial threat that the city–states formed the Grand Companies, and forged the Eorzean Alliance anew. But Garlemald was not content to wager all on a simple contest of martial might. They had other plans─the Meteor project.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Legatus Nael van Darnus─hells take him─intended to “cleanse” our realm by snatching the lesser moon, Dalamud, from the heavens and casting it down upon our heads. Desperate to prevent this lunatic scheme, we marched our forces to the Carteneau Flats and there met the VIIth Imperial Legion in battle.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Never have I seen a fight like the Battle of Carteneau─and I have seen full many.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But though we gave no quarter, spared not one onze of effort...we could not prevent what followed.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: From inside the shell of Dalamud came a winged nightmare─a dragon the size of a bloody city. 'Twas the elder primal Bahamut, bent on making an eighth hell of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: In the space of a breath, the legions of the Empire were set aflame, while our own armies fared little better. 'Twas as if the whole world was burning... Words cannot well describe the scene.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And yet...by some miracle, a few among us were spared.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Even as I steeled myself for death, a blinding white light enveloped me, robbing me of my senses.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: When I regained them, the dragon was gone, and the still-smoldering land was warped beyond all knowing.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Were Archon Louisoix still with us, he would doubtless shed some light on these unfathomable happenings. Alas, he is not, and I fear we will want for his wisdom in the days to come.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: For while our nations struggle to recover from the devastation, the beastmen call forth their damned primals to torment us anew.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Unless we put aside our differences and rebuild now, our foes will catch us unprepared.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And I speak not only of the beastmen. Do not imagine that the Empire has forsaken its claim on Eorzea. The imperials crowd our borders, waiting to strike.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Damn it all, we need champions to replace those we lost...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But such thoughts are worse than worthless. Time is short, and none will save us, save ourselves. It is the duty of every soul who survived the Calamity to work together for the good of Eorzea...and this memorial service may be the very thing to unite us.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye, Kan–E–Senna has the right of it. I accept her proposal.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Your duty is done here, adventurer─I will see to it that the Elder Seedseer receives my reply.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You travel next to Ul'dah, yes?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Pray give my regards to General Raubahn. Oh, and tell him the wolf has been sniffing around the stables. A private jest─and one in poor taste─but I would have you tell it all the same.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Fare you well, Forename. May the Navigator guide you on your journey.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. This is the counter for passengers traveling to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: A pleasure to serve you again, madamsir. Are you ready to board the airship to Ul'dah?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Very well, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you are.

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Do you wish to leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: We hope you have a pleasant voyage.

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Are you ready to depart, madamsir? The airship bound for Ul'dah will be leaving shortly.

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: LNOPHLO
dialogue.text: Very well, madamsir. I'll be glad to assist you when you're ready.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Board the airship?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the envoy from Gridania! Welcome to Ul'dah, madamsir. The Flame General awaits your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: Leave the landing area?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CABINCREW
dialogue.text: Please let me know if you require any assistance.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: Welcome to Ul'dah, madamsir. We have been expecting you.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: Flame General Raubahn will receive you in the Fragrant Chamber. Please take the lift down to the Hustings Strip and speak with Bartholomew at the Royal Promenade.

dialogue.name: FLAMEA
dialogue.text: The lift over yonder will take you to the Hustings Strip. From there, proceed south to the Royal Promenade, and speak with Bartholomew to gain admittance to the Fragrant Chamber.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: The Gridanian envoy, I presume? Would you be so good as to allow me to inspect the missive you bear, madamsir? My thanks.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: Ah yes, the seal of the Elder Seedseer. Please proceed.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, a guest from Gridania. I thought I smelled leaf mold.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I won't hold it against you. If you're half the warrior Kan-E says, 'tis a wonder you don't reek of dead Ixal.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the sultanate of Ul'dah. I am Raubahn Aldynn, General of the Immortal Flames.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But you did not come all this way to trade formalities.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: There's something familiar about you... For a moment, I mistook you for an old sister-in-armsbrother-in-arms.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Like herhim, you have the eyes of a hero. Eyes that have looked upon the horrors of battle, unblinking.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've no doubt Kan-E saw them, too. Mayhap there is hope for Gridania yet! Come, let us talk.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...Carteneau. Aye, I remember bloody Carteneau.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Do you know what happened that day, adventurer? When we took the field against the Garleans?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: So my counterparts have educated you.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hm? Oh. Trust Merlwyb to make light of our wolf problem. Woman always did have a black sense of humor.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Wolves are bloodthirsty beasts upon which one cannot turn one's back. 'Tis only a matter of time before they bite.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: So it was with the Garleans, fifty years ago.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: No sooner had they learned how to use magitek than they began seizing territory from their neighbors.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Led by then legatus Solus zos Galvus, they swiftly brought the other nations of Ilsabard to heel. And so the legatus became an emperor, and his republic an empire...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: An empire which then set its sights upon Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: But the conquering emperor is now an old man of four score winters. His health is failing, and he has no clear successor. Like as not, this is why the Garleans have been quiet of late.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the XIVth Imperial Legion is still entrenched within our borders.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And their commander, Legatus Gaius van Baelsar, has long harbored ambitions of conquest.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Were he to strike now, I fear we would fall like so many others before us. And not only Ul'dah, but Gridania and Limsa Lominsa as well.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For the Calamity brought the lot of us to our knees, and we've yet to get up. We barely have the strength to stand against the beast tribes, never mind the primals they mean to summon.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We are a realm divided, adventurer. An alliance in name only.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the wolf cares not for the plight of its prey.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The Garleans stir, and the Admiral would not let it go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: All other concerns pale in comparison to the Empire─even the beast tribes and their bloody primals.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We must stand united once more, that much is clear. And if we're to do so, we must remember the cause which last brought us together. Kan–E will have her memorial.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We will honor the memory of the fallen. We will remind the people what their brothers and sisters fought and died for.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: Shall I inform the sultana and the Syndicate?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I will speak with Her Grace myself.

dialogue.name: ROAILLE
dialogue.text: Very good, sir.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer will have my reply anon.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: My thanks to you, adventurer.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now make use of the airship routes connecting the three nations. Before you may board an airship, you must pay the requisite fare in gil.

dialogue.name: Q11
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Lotus Stand?

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A11
dialogue.text: No
